# swagger-java-client

Mlog API
- API version: 1.0.0
  - Build date: 2025-11-22T22:34:44.096746781+07:00[Asia/Bangkok]

API Gateway for Blog Microservices (Content, Engagement)


*Automatically generated by the [Swagger Codegen](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.7+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.swagger</groupId>
  <artifactId>swagger-java-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
compile "io.swagger:swagger-java-client:1.0.0"
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/swagger-java-client-1.0.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java
import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.AdminApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class AdminApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        AdminApi apiInstance = new AdminApi();
        UserIdBanBody body = new UserIdBanBody(); // UserIdBanBody | Informations about why the user is banned
        Object userId = null; // Object | 
        try {
            apiInstance.apiV1AdminUsersUserIdBanPost(body, userId);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling AdminApi#apiV1AdminUsersUserIdBanPost");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.AdminApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class AdminApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        AdminApi apiInstance = new AdminApi();
        UserIdUnbanBody body = new UserIdUnbanBody(); // UserIdUnbanBody | Informations about why the user is unbanned
        Object userId = null; // Object | 
        try {
            apiInstance.apiV1AdminUsersUserIdUnbanPost(body, userId);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling AdminApi#apiV1AdminUsersUserIdUnbanPost");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```

All URIs are relative to *http://localhost:5000*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*AdminApi* | [**apiV1AdminUsersUserIdBanPost**](docs/AdminApi.md#apiV1AdminUsersUserIdBanPost) | **POST** /api/v1/admin/users/{user_id}/ban | Ban user with user_id
*AdminApi* | [**apiV1AdminUsersUserIdUnbanPost**](docs/AdminApi.md#apiV1AdminUsersUserIdUnbanPost) | **POST** /api/v1/admin/users/{user_id}/unban | Unban user with user_id

*BlogsApi* | [**apiV1BlogsBlogIdGet**](docs/BlogsApi.md#apiV1BlogsBlogIdGet) | **GET** /api/v1/blogs/{blog_id} | Getting blog by id
*BlogsApi* | [**apiV1BlogsBlogIdPatch**](docs/BlogsApi.md#apiV1BlogsBlogIdPatch) | **PATCH** /api/v1/blogs/{blog_id} | Edit a blog using id
*BlogsApi* | [**apiV1BlogsBlogIdPut**](docs/BlogsApi.md#apiV1BlogsBlogIdPut) | **PUT** /api/v1/blogs/{blog_id} | Edit a blog using id
*BlogsApi* | [**apiV1BlogsGet**](docs/BlogsApi.md#apiV1BlogsGet) | **GET** /api/v1/blogs | Returns list of all blogs

*CommentsApi* | [**apiV1CommentsCommentIdDelete**](docs/CommentsApi.md#apiV1CommentsCommentIdDelete) | **DELETE** /api/v1/comments/{comment_id} | Soft delete a comment

*CommentsApi* | [**apiV1PostsPostIdCommentsGet**](docs/CommentsApi.md#apiV1PostsPostIdCommentsGet) | **GET** /api/v1/posts/{post_id}/comments | Get root comment for a post
*FollowsApi* | [**apiV1UsersTargetUserIdFollowDelete**](docs/FollowsApi.md#apiV1UsersTargetUserIdFollowDelete) | **DELETE** /api/v1/users/{target_user_id}/follow | Unfollow a user
*FollowsApi* | [**apiV1UsersTargetUserIdFollowPost**](docs/FollowsApi.md#apiV1UsersTargetUserIdFollowPost) | **POST** /api/v1/users/{target_user_id}/follow | Follow a user (author)
*FollowsApi* | [**apiV1UsersUserIdFollowersGet**](docs/FollowsApi.md#apiV1UsersUserIdFollowersGet) | **GET** /api/v1/users/{user_id}/followers | Get list of followers
*FollowsApi* | [**apiV1UsersUserIdFollowingGet**](docs/FollowsApi.md#apiV1UsersUserIdFollowingGet) | **GET** /api/v1/users/{user_id}/following | Get list of following
*KeycloakApi* | [**apiV1AuthCallbackGet**](docs/KeycloakApi.md#apiV1AuthCallbackGet) | **GET** /api/v1/auth/callback | OAuth2 callback endpoint for Keycloak
*KeycloakApi* | [**apiV1AuthGet**](docs/KeycloakApi.md#apiV1AuthGet) | **GET** /api/v1/auth | Redirect to Keycloak account management page
*KeycloakApi* | [**apiV1AuthLoginGet**](docs/KeycloakApi.md#apiV1AuthLoginGet) | **GET** /api/v1/auth/login | Redirect user to Keycloak for login
*KeycloakApi* | [**apiV1AuthLogoutGet**](docs/KeycloakApi.md#apiV1AuthLogoutGet) | **GET** /api/v1/auth/logout | Logout user and end Keycloak session

*KeycloakApi* | [**apiV1AuthRegisterGet**](docs/KeycloakApi.md#apiV1AuthRegisterGet) | **GET** /api/v1/auth/register | Redirect to Keycloak registration page
*LikesApi* | [**apiV1PostsPostIdLikesDelete**](docs/LikesApi.md#apiV1PostsPostIdLikesDelete) | **DELETE** /api/v1/posts/{post_id}/likes | Unlike a post
*LikesApi* | [**apiV1PostsPostIdLikesGet**](docs/LikesApi.md#apiV1PostsPostIdLikesGet) | **GET** /api/v1/posts/{post_id}/likes | Get list of users who liked the post
*LikesApi* | [**apiV1PostsPostIdLikesPost**](docs/LikesApi.md#apiV1PostsPostIdLikesPost) | **POST** /api/v1/posts/{post_id}/likes | Like a post
*UsersApi* | [**apiV1UsersGet**](docs/UsersApi.md#apiV1UsersGet) | **GET** /api/v1/users | Get all users
*UsersApi* | [**apiV1UsersMeGet**](docs/UsersApi.md#apiV1UsersMeGet) | **GET** /api/v1/users/me | Get my user info

## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
